title: Portable Battery Charging Station Invented by InventHelp Client (WDH-590)
text:
InventHelp, based in Pittsburgh, is attempting to submit THE ULTIMATE CHARGER to companies for their consideration.
PITTSBURGH, PA (PRWEB) October 11, 2015
If you’ve ever encountered a dead cell phone battery and did not have your charger handy, you can benefit from the creativity of an inventor from Alexandria, Va., His idea provides a way to charge your battery in public areas without having to stand in line.
He developed THE ULTIMATE CHARGER to allow multiple users to charge their cell phones and other electronic devices simultaneously. As such, it attaches easily to a bar or counter top without drilling or damage to the surface. As a result, it improves customer service and stimulates business in bars and restaurants. Besides that, it keeps the area neat and organized. Not only is it suitable for a variety of public areas and places of business, it is also designed for home use. It is also compact, effective and attractive styled. In addition, it is convenient, user friendly and cost effective. The idea is patent pending.
The inventor’s personal experience inspired the idea. “After seeing drawers full of outdated chargers in bars, I decided to pursue the idea of a universal charger that would require minimal space but would meet customers’ needs for charging their electronic devices,” he said.
The original design was submitted to the Washington, DC office of InventHelp. It is currently available for licensing or sale to manufacturers or marketers. For more information, write Dept. 14-WDH-590, InventHelp, 217 Ninth Street, Pittsburgh, PA 15222, or call (412) 288-1300 ext. 1368. Learn more about InventHelp's Invention Submission Services at http://www.InventHelp.com - https://www.youtube.com/user/inventhelp
